My distinguished colonel and respectable friend  
Piratini, January 9, 1839.

Not wishing to take a decision regarding the primary school teacher of São Gabriel without consulting Your Excellency, Your Excellency

Your secretary must necessarily be lacking, but the position for which he was entrusted is vacant because it is not right to fill it while the owner is employed there. I believe he will not lack patriotism and that, if he wishes to keep his job, he must himself put another in his place, or resign it to later be employed in something better.

Tell me, Your Excellency,

Your sincere and very grateful friend  
Domingos José de Almeida  
Piratini, January 9, 1839
